comments:
Driver:  WTP 2.0 06/13 driver

After creating a dynamic Web project, change the default Java output directory to non-default directory to something other than build/classes , then the Java class files are not copied into the services directory.

The Java output directory can be changed by going into Project -> Properties -> Java Build Path.  Choose the Source tab and enter a directory for "default output folder".

Actually, there are probably other directory strings that are hardcoded which should be obtained programmatically.  For example, the Java output directory can be obtained by ResourceUtils.getJavaOutputLocation(IProject).
*** Bug 192521 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Increasing severity as the some adopter product have the default Java Output folder set to WebContent/WEB-INF/classes, not build/classes.

Here is the stacktrace that I get for this scenario:

*** Bug 193644 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Hi Lahiru,

Would it be possible to get a patch for this problem as we are hitting this every time when creating an Axis2 Web service for an adoptor product that has the Java output directory always defaulted to a directory other than build/classes?

Created an attachment (id=72328)
Fix for the Bug 192522

Hi Kathy,

I am attaching the patch for the build path issue. Please review.
The fix include for the BU/TD service creation commands. 
Because you have proposed to use the I have used the ResourceUtils.getJavaOutputLocation(IPath), But found that it was deprecated in my latest source that I have. 
Please comment?

thanks 

Lahiru
tested and verified the attached fix, assigning the bug..
Patch reviewed and tested.  Will commit once a WTP 2.0 branch is created.  I'll attach the exported plugin JAR for folks who want to workaround this problem.

Created an attachment (id=72382)
axis2.creation.core plugin JAR

Replace the org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.core JAR in RC4 with this one.  If you need to replace this JAR in RC3, rename it to org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.creation.core_1.0.0.v200706130319.jar.
Tested the patch with adopter product based on RC3, it is working as expected.
Patch committed to HEAD and released to HEAD and R2_0_maintenance.  This fix is now going into WTP 2.0.1 and WTP 3.0.

If these defects are still left in the Resolve state in a couple of weeks, we might verify and close these defects on behalf of the originator.  But since you know the original problem best, it would be best if you could take a moment to verify these defects in the latest available drivers.  Thanks!
